response:
Subacute evolution over days with vascular risk factors and crossed brainstem signs makes a paramedian midbrain infarct most likely; haemorrhagic and structural midbrain lesions are next; demyelination is less likely at this age but possible; a PCom aneurysm is considered because of a pupil-involving III palsy, though it would not explain the contralateral pyramidal/ataxic signs alone.

differential_diagnosis = ["Paramedian midbrain infarction (Weber/Claude/Benedikt syndrome)", "Midbrain haemorrhage", "Midbrain cavernous malformation", "Primary midbrain glioma or metastasis", "Demyelinating brainstem lesion (multiple sclerosis or NMOSD)", "Posterior communicating artery aneurysm causing third-nerve palsy"]
